p: Chrysin is a natural flavone, especially derived from bee products such as propolis, honeycomb or honey. It can also be extracted from passion flowers and chamomile [ 107]. There is a small amount of studies conducted in order to elucidate the biological mechanism of chrysin on endometriosis. Ryu et al. [ 108] showed that chrysin exerted pro-apoptotic effects on End1/E6E7 and VK2/E6E7 endometriotic cells. Furthermore, it inhibited the proliferation of the cells. The programmed cell death was induced by increasing intracytosolic level of reactive oxygen species. Moreover, chrysin downregulated PI3K/AKT signaling pathway in a dose-dependent manner.
